alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Harrison; Pearl River (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 1:56PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Harrison, northeastern Hancock and northeastern Pearl River Counties through 300 PM CDT... At 155 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near McHenry, or 11 miles south of Wiggins, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Poplarville, Saucier and Mcneil. This includes Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 13 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
